components.docs: The TkAccordion component is a user interface element that organizes content under headers, allowing users to expand and collapse sections by clicking on each header. It is particularly useful for improving layout and readability on pages with extensive information.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: default - Default slot to detect TkAccordionItem components.

props.name: activeIndex
props.docs:
Currently active panel indexes. Can be a single value or an array.
When allowMultiple is false, only the last value in the array will be used.

props.name: allowMultiple
props.docs: Allows multiple accordion items to be expanded simultaneously.

props.name: arrowPosition
props.docs: Sets the position of opening and closing chevrons.

props.name: collapseIcon
props.docs: Sets the collapse icon

props.name: expandIcon
props.docs: Sets the expand icon

props.name: hideArrows
props.docs: Whether to hide the arrow icons.

props.name: type
props.docs: Sets accordion style for the component.

events.docs: Emitted when an accordion item is selected

slots.name: default
slots.docs: Default slot to detect TkAccordionItem components.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: header - Custom header template that overrides the header prop if provided.

props.name: active
props.docs: Sets if the accordion is active.

props.name: header
props.docs: Header text to display.

props.name: icon
props.docs: Icon for accordion component.

props.name: itemKey
props.docs: Optional key for the accordion item.

props.name: size
props.docs: Sets size for the component.

props.name: toggleItem
props.docs: Toggle's the accordion item.

slots.name: content
slots.docs: Custom content template.

slots.name: header
slots.docs: Custom header template that overrides the header prop if provided.

components.docs: The TkAlert component is designed to display contextual feedback messages, such as success, warnings, informational notices, and errors.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: right-action - Custom actions template to right content.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: footer-action - Custom actions template to default footer.

props.name: header
props.docs: The header text displayed at the top of the alert.

props.name: icon
props.docs: The icon displayed in the alert. If not provided, a default icon is used based on the variant.

props.name: iconSize
props.docs: Size of the icon displayed in the alert ('small', 'base', or 'large').

props.name: message
props.docs: The message text displayed within the alert.

props.name: removable
props.docs: The alert can be closed by the user.

props.name: type
props.docs: This field specifies the design type of the component.

props.name: variant
props.docs: Defines the visual variant of the alert.

slots.name: footer-action
slots.docs: Custom actions template to default footer.

slots.name: right-action
slots.docs: Custom actions template to right content.

components.docs: The `TkAvatar` represents a user, labels, and display the images or a brand.

props.name: ariaLabelledby
props.docs: ID of the element that labels the avatar - accessibility

props.name: background
props.docs: Background style of the avatar

props.name: badge
props.docs: The badge to be displayed in the avatar

props.name: badgeStatus
props.docs: The status of the badge

props.name: image
props.docs: URL of the image to be displayed in the avatar

props.name: label
props.docs: Text label to be displayed in the avatar

props.name: name
props.docs: Name associated with the avatar - accessibility

props.name: rounded
props.docs: Whether the avatar should have rounded corners

props.name: size
props.docs: Size of the avatar

props.name: variant
props.docs: Appearance of the avatar

props.name: compact
props.docs: Whether the avatars should have a shared background

components.docs: The TkBadge component allows you to create a small badge for adding information like contextual data that needs to stand out and get noticed. It is also often useful in combination with other elements like a user avatar to show a number of new messages.

props.name: count
props.docs: Defines the number for the element.

props.name: dot
props.docs: If true, shows a small dot on the badge.

props.name: icon
props.docs: Specifies a material icon name to be displayed.

props.name: iconPosition
props.docs: Defines the position of the icon.

props.name: label
props.docs: Defines the label for the element.

props.name: rounded
props.docs: Makes the badge corners rounded.

props.name: size
props.docs: Sets size for the component.

props.name: type
props.docs: This field specifies the design type of the component.

props.name: variant
props.docs: Determines the badge's variant for different styles.

components.docs: The `TkBreadcrumb` provides a navigational aid, allowing users to keep track of their location within the application's hierarchy.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: default - Default slot to detect TkBreadcrumbItem components.

props.name: model
props.docs: Array of breadcrumb items

props.name: separator
props.docs: Type of separator to use between breadcrumb items

props.name: separatorIcon
props.docs: Icon to use as separator when separator is set to 'icon'

props.name: type
props.docs: Defines the visual style of the component, possible values are 'basic' and 'outlined'.

slots.name: default
slots.docs: Default slot to detect TkBreadcrumbItem components.

props.name: href
props.docs: URL for the item

props.name: icon
props.docs: Icon to display alongside the label

props.name: isCurrent
props.docs: Indicates if the item is the last one

props.name: isExternal
props.docs: Whether the item is an external url

props.name: label
props.docs: Label text for the breadcrumb item

components.docs: TkButton is an extension to standard input element with icons and theming.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: Disables the button, preventing user interaction.

props.name: fullWidth
props.docs: Sets the button to full-width mode, making it span the container.

props.name: href
props.docs: Sets the URL the button should navigate to when clicked (for type="link" buttons).

props.name: icon
props.docs: Specifies a material icon name to be displayed.

props.name: iconPosition
props.docs: Defines the position of the icon.

props.name: label
props.docs: Label text displayed inside the button.

props.name: loading
props.docs: Shows a loading icon inside the button.

props.name: mode
props.docs: Sets the button type.

props.name: rounded
props.docs: Makes the button round with an icon-only style.

props.name: size
props.docs: Sets size for the component.

props.name: target
props.docs: Specifies where to open the linked document (for type="link" buttons).

props.name: type
props.docs: This field specifies the design type of the component.

props.name: underline
props.docs: Applies underline styling to the button (for type="link" buttons).

props.name: variant
props.docs: Determines the button's variant for different styles.

events.docs: Emitted when the button click.

components.docs: The TkChart component allows users to visualize data in various chart formats using Chart.js.

props.name: accessibilityLabel
props.docs: Accessibility label for the chart

props.name: data
props.type: ChartData<keyof ChartTypeRegistry, (number | Point | [number, number] | BubbleDataPoint)[], unknown>

props.docs: Chart data prop is used to define chart data supported by the Chart.js library. With this prop, you can specify chart data described in the Chart.js documentation (https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/general/data-structures.html).

props.name: height
props.docs: Height of the chart container in pixels

components.docs: The TkCheckbox component is another basic element for user input. You can use this to supply a way for the user to toggle an option.

props.name: description
props.docs: The description sub text displayed.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If true, the user cannot interact with the checkbox.

props.name: indeterminate
props.docs: If true, the checkbox will be indeterminate.

props.name: invalid
props.docs: Indicates whether the input is in an invalid state

props.name: label
props.docs: Defines the label for the checkbox.

props.name: name
props.docs: Name of the checkbox

props.name: type
props.docs: Determines the appearance types of the checkbox.

props.name: value
props.docs: Sets the checkbox value

events.docs: Emitted when the checkbox checked state changes.

slots.name: content
slots.docs: Custom content template.

components.docs: The TkChip component is basically a simple UI block entity, representing for example more advanced underlying data, such as a contact, in a compact way. Chips can contain entities such as an avatar, text or an icon, optionally having a pointer too.

props.name: autoSelfDestroy
props.docs: Determines whether the chip automatically removes itself when the close button is clicked.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: The disabled status.

props.name: icon
props.docs: Specifies a material icon name to be displayed.

props.name: label
props.docs: The label to display inside the chip.

props.name: removable
props.docs: This property determines whether the chip component is removable.

props.name: size
props.docs: Sets size for the component.

props.name: type
props.docs: This field specifies the design type of the component.

props.name: variant
props.docs: The variant of the chip for styling.

events.docs: When an element is deleted, it is triggered. It returns the label.

components.docs: TkCurrencyInput component description.

props.name: currency
props.docs: Specifies the currency to be displayed.

props.name: currencyOptions
props.docs: Defines the available currency options for the user to select from.

props.name: decimalSeparator
props.docs: Sets the character used to separate the decimal part.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the input.

props.name: error
props.docs: This is the error message that will be displayed.

props.name: hint
props.docs: Provided a hint or additional information about the input.

props.name: icon
props.docs: Specifies a material icon name to be displayed.

props.name: invalid
props.docs: Indicates whether the input is in an invalid state.

props.name: label
props.docs: Defines the label for the input.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: placeholder
props.docs: Placeholder text displayed when the input is empty.

props.name: precision
props.docs: Determines the number of decimal places to display, like 2 decimal places for cents.

props.name: readonly
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot modify the value.

props.name: size
props.docs: Sets size for the component.

props.name: thousandsSeparator
props.docs: Specifies the character used to separate thousands in large numbers.

props.name: value
props.docs: The value of the input.

methods.name: setFocus
methods.docs:
Sets focus on the specified `tk-input`. Use this method instead of the global
`input.focus()`.

events.docs: Emitted when the input loses focus.
Emitted when the value has changed.
Emitted when the input has focus.
Emitted when a keyboard input occurred.

components.docs: The `TkDatepicker` component is a versatile and customizable date picker that supports `single` date and date `range` selection. It offers various display modes, localization, and customizable date formatting.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: footer-actions - Custom actions template to default footer.

props.name: allowedDates
props.docs:
Array of dates that are allowed to be selected. All other dates will be disabled.

Note: Format should match dateFormat prop

props.name: clearable
props.docs: Indicates whether the input of datepicker can be cleared

props.name: dateFormat
props.docs: Date format pattern

props.name: disableMask
props.docs: Whether to disable input mask

props.name: disabled
props.docs: Whether the datepicker is disabled

props.name: disabledDates
props.docs:
Array of dates that are disabled for selection.

Format should match dateFormat prop

props.name: disabledWeekDays
props.docs:
Disabled week days (0-6, where 0 is Sunday and 6 is Saturday)
Example: [0,6] will disable Sunday and Saturday

props.name: error
props.docs: Error message to display

props.name: firstDayOfWeekIndex
props.docs:
Defines the first day of the week. 0 for Monday, 1 for Tuesday, ..., 6 for Sunday.
If not provided, the first day of the week is determined by the `locale` prop.
If neither `firstDayOfWeekIndex` nor `locale` provide a value, defaults to Monday (0).
Providing this prop overrides the locale setting for the start of the week.

props.name: footerType
props.docs: The visual variant of the footer: 'basic', 'divided', or 'light'.

props.name: headerType
props.docs: Header visual variant

props.name: hint
props.docs: Hint text to display

props.name: hourStep
props.docs: Hour increment step.

props.name: inline
props.docs: Whether to display inline panel

props.name: invalid
props.docs: Whether the datepicker is in an invalid state

props.name: label
props.docs: Defines the label for the input

props.name: locale
props.docs: Locale for date formatting

props.name: maxDate
props.docs: Maximum selectable date

props.name: maxTime
props.docs: Maximum selectable time (HH:mm format).

props.name: minDate
props.docs: Minimum selectable date

props.name: minTime
props.docs: Minimum selectable time (HH:mm format).

props.name: minuteStep
props.docs: Minute increment step.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The selection mode of the date picker: 'single' for single date selection, 'range' for date range selection.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control.

props.name: placeholder
props.docs: Input placeholder text

props.name: showAsterisk
props.docs: Displays a red asterisk (*) next to the label for visual emphasis.

props.name: showTimePicker
props.docs: Whether to show the timepicker panel next to the calendar.

props.name: timeFormat
props.docs: Time format: '12' or '24'.

props.name: value
props.docs: The value representing the selected date(s)

methods.name: setToday
methods.docs: Sets the date to today

events.docs: Emitted on date selection changes
Emitted on input value changes

slots.name: footer
slots.docs: Custom footer template.

slots.name: footer-actions
slots.docs: Custom actions template to default footer.

components.docs: The `TkDialog` component provides a customizable modal dialog for displaying important information or requesting user input. It supports various configurations including different header types, variants, and customizable content.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: default - Default slot to detect child to inner content.

docsTags.name: slot

methods.name: close
methods.docs:
Requests to close the dialog by emitting a tk-close event.
Note: This method only emits an event. The dialog will only close if the parent component
listens for this event and updates the 'visible' prop to false.

methods.name: open
methods.docs:
Requests to open the dialog by emitting a tk-open event.
Note: This method only emits an event. The dialog will only open if the parent component
listens for this event and updates the 'visible' prop to true.

events.docs: Event emitted when the dialog is closed
Event emitted when the dialog is opened
Event emitted when the dialog visibility changes

components.docs: The `TkDrawer` is a container component displayed as an overlay. It supports various features such as different header and footer types, multiple variants, and flexible positioning, making it suitable for a wide range of use cases.

components.docs:
The TkIcon component allows you to create a icon for adding visual information. It is also often useful in combination with other elements.
This component uses Google's Material Symbols icons. For a complete list of available icon names, please visit:
https://fonts.google.com/icons?icon.set=Material+Symbols

With this prop, you can specify any masking options described in the Cleave.js documentation (https://nosir.github.io/cleave.js/). For example, you can configure it for formatting dates, phone numbers, or credit card numbers as needed.

components.docs: TkTable is a component that allows you to display data in a tabular manner. It's generally called a datatable.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: empty-data - Set how the table will appear when there is no data

props.name: cellStyle
props.docs:
Provides a function to customize cell styles.
This function takes row and column information and returns a style for a specific cell.

props.name: columns
props.docs: The column definitions (Array of Objects)

props.name: data
props.docs: Rows of data to display

props.name: dataKey
props.docs: Property of each row that defines the unique key of each row

props.name: expandedRows
props.docs: Specifies which rows are expanded to show additional content.

props.name: headerType
props.docs: Style to apply to header of table

props.name: loading
props.docs: Displays a loading indicator while data is being fetched or processed.

props.name: paginationMethod
props.docs: Defines whether pagination is handled on the client or server side.

props.name: paginationType
props.docs: The type of the pagination

props.name: rowStyle
props.docs:
Provides a function to customize row styles.
This function takes row information and returns a style for a specific row.

props.name: rowsPerPage
props.docs: Number of items per page.

props.name: rowsPerPageOptions
props.docs: Number of rows per page options

props.name: selection
props.docs: List of the selected

props.name: selectionMode
props.docs: Determines how rows can be selected, either with radio buttons (single selection) or checkboxes (multiple selection).

props.name: size
props.docs: Sets size for the component.

props.name: striped
props.docs: Enables or disables alternating row background colors for easier readability.

props.name: totalItems
props.docs: Number of total items.

methods.name: clearFilters
methods.docs: Clears all filters for server side pagination

methods.name: clearSorting
methods.docs: Clears all sorting for server side pagination

methods.name: exportFile
methods.docs: Exports the table data to a file

methods.name: getFilters
methods.docs: Returns the current filters

methods.name: getSorting
methods.docs: Returns the current sorting settings

methods.name: serverRequest
methods.docs: Allows tk-request event to be triggered manually

events.docs: Emitted when a cell is edited.
Emitted when the expanded rows change.
Emitted when a request needs to be made to the server.
Emitted when a row is clicked.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: row The row data that was clicked

slots.name: empty-data
slots.docs: Set how the table will appear when there is no data

components.docs: The TkUpload component is an interface element that allows users to select and upload files from their devices to a server or a target location. It typically includes a "Choose File" button and a field displaying the selected file's name. This component simplifies the process of file selection and uploading.

props.name: accept
props.docs: Acceptable file types for upload. Use MIME types or extensions separated by commas.

props.name: autoUpload
props.docs:
If `autoUpload` is set to `true`, the upload button will be hidden,
and the `tkUpload` event will be automatically triggered for each newly added file.

props.name: chooseButtonLabel
props.docs: Label text displayed inside the choose button.

props.name: description
props.docs: Description displayed under the title.
props.default: 'JPEG, PNG, PDF and MP4 formats, up to 50 MB.'

props.name: disabled
props.docs: Disables the input, preventing user interaction.

props.name: error
props.docs: Provided a error about the upload.

props.name: hint
props.docs: Provided a hint or additional information about the input.

props.name: invalid
props.docs: Indicates whether the upload is in an invalid state, uploads will fail eventually

props.name: label
props.docs: Defines the label of the upload area

props.name: loading
props.docs: Indicates whether the upload is in an loading state

props.name: maxFileCount
props.docs: Maximum allowed file count

props.name: maxFileSize
props.docs: Maximum allowed file size in bytes.

props.name: multiple
props.docs: Allows multiple file selection.

props.name: showAsterisk
props.docs: Displays a red asterisk (*) next to the label for visual emphasis.

props.name: title
props.docs: Title displayed in the upload component.
props.default: 'Choose a file or drag & drop it here.'

props.name: type
props.docs: Type of the file upload area.

props.name: uploadButtonLabel
props.docs: Label text displayed inside the upload button.

props.name: value
props.docs: The file value of the upload.

events.docs: Emitted when one or more files pass validation.
Emitted when one or more files fail validation, with reasons.
Emitted when a file is removed from the accepted list.
Emitted when the user initiates file upload.
